name: Holland S. Hargens
summary: Computer Engineering student with strong experience in machine learning, embedded systems, and data analysis. Skilled in MATLAB, Python, C++, and building data-driven and embedded software systems.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering

bullets: Developed preprocessing pipelines for polymer sensor data using Python
Implemented baseline regression and classification models for real-world datasets
Conducted statistical analysis and visualization of high-dimensional sensor data
Collaborated with a cross-functional engineering team on scalable machine learning research
Evaluated AI model outputs across Python, Java, and algorithmic reasoning tasks
Designed structured feedback frameworks to improve model correctness and efficiency
Worked on natural language reasoning and algorithm design evaluation

projects.name: PSOC6 Blackjack Game
bullets: Developed firmware in C for the PSOC6 microcontroller implementing real-time game logic
Integrated hardware peripherals using UART and I2C communication protocols
Optimized system performance through timing analysis and debugging

projects.name: Personal Manager App with AI Assistant
bullets: Built a modular web application for managing tasks, workouts, and schedules
Designed backend services using Next.js, Supabase, and Python-based agents
Integrated natural language interfaces for AI-driven task interaction

projects.name: AI-Powered Song Recommendation System
bullets: Built backend services using Python, Flask, and SQLite
Integrated external APIs for real-time music metadata
Implemented recommendation models using Scikit-learn and Pandas

leadership: Boy Scouts of America Eagle Scout
